article_title: Mayor proposes $873 million budget, doubling amount for paving roads and sidewalks

article_metadata.description: Fischer says the city has recovered from the Great Recession.

og.description: Fischer says the city has recovered from the Great Recession.
og.title: Mayor proposes $873 million budget, doubling amount for paving roads and sidewalks - Insider Louisville

article_summary:
The budget devotes $275,000 to the planting of trees and a GPS tracking system to expand Louisville’s tree canopy.
One notable feature of the budget is $13.6 million to repave roads, fix sidewalks and create new bike lanes, doubling the amount from last year’s budget.
As was also previously announced, the budget allocates $2.8 million for new body cameras for all Louisville Metro Police officers.
As was announced two weeks ago, Fischer’s budget devotes $12 million to the Louisville CARES initiative, which will go toward the construction of 1,500 affordable housing units.
Fischer’s budget also devotes $14.5 million to construct the new South Central Regional Library in Okolona, which is expected to break ground late this fall.
